the baseline characteristics and risk status of the woman at the time of labour admission. 
Other important demographic and labour characteristics, such as the woman’s age, 
gestational age, serology results, haemoglobin, blood type and Rh factor, referral status and 
cause, and symphysis–fundal height, should be included in the woman’s medical record.
